clinical_study.brief_title: Emotional Experience and Burnout in Physician
clinical_study.official_title: National Study of the Psychological Consequences Resulting From the Practice of Invasive Therapeutic Interventions: Mixed Evaluation, Qualitative and Quantitative, of Burn Out Among Digestive Surgeons, Gastroenterologists and Radiologists

brief_summary.textblock: Recent studies have highlighted a high incidence of burnout among surgeons. The aim of this study is in particular to investigate if this is the consequence of performing surgery (i.e. invasive procedures) or whether it is related to the cultural background of surgeons.

detailed_description.textblock: A mixed method approach (qualitative approach and quantitative approach) will be used to investigate surgeons, as well as gastroenterologists and radiologists who perform invasive procedures and gastroenterologists and radiologists who do not perform invasive procedures. The qualitative approach will rely on face-to face interviews with purposively sampled physicians of the 5 groups and will be continued until saturation. The quantitative approach will rely on a questionnaire that will be sent to physicians of the 5 groups.

primary_outcome.description: Compare the emotional experience and incidence of burnout between surgeons, gastroenterologists and radiologists

secondary_outcome.measure: physicians understanding of the Maslach Burnout Inventory (MBI) questionnaire will be reported by interview
physician's emotions will be reported by interview and MBI questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: concordance between the questionnaire and the interview

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation score depending on the specialty and professional experience
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the MBI score over time
